author: Special Correspondent
text:
Palayamkottai Taluk police arrested an old man and his two sons for attempting to murder the Assistant Manager of a private school.

The police said that Nainar (65) of Uthamapandiankulam, who owns a land near his village, had dispute with the owner of an adjacent property. When the surveyors, hired by the adjacent property owner, tried to measure the land on Wednesday in a bid to solve the dispute, Nainar and his sons Sudalaimuthu (32) and Maharajan (27), tried to attack them with lethal weapons.

However, the surveyors and their assistants escaped unhurt as they boarded the vehicles and left the spot immediately.

Suspecting that the surveyors and the assistants were hiding in the nearby matriculation higher secondary school, Nainar, Sudalaimuthu and Maharajan entered the school premises with weapons and started searching for them. When it was objected by the Assistant Manager of the school, Venkatesh of Thimmarajapuram, the trio attacked him with weapons in which the victim sustained grievous cut injury on the head.

He has been admitted to Tirunelveli Medical College Hospital and his condition is reportedly “stable”.
title: Attempt to murder school official
